newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovene profile firm on Kucan reelection aim - D&B.
newsitem.headline: Slovene profile firm on Kucan reelection aim - D&B.

text.p: Business information agency Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) said on Thursday Slovenia's political profile was buoyed by President Milan Kucan's decision to stand for re-election this year.

"The political risk profile will be buoyed by ever-popular President Milan Kucan's June decision to stand for re-election at polls due by end 1997," the agency's Ljubljana office said in its latest Risk & Payment Review.
Political analysts said Kucan, who has been acting as president of Slovenia since 1990 when it was still a part of the former Yugoslavia, is very likely to gain another five-year term in office.
D&B awarded Slovenia a DB3a rating, unchanged for the 13th consecutive month, placing it behind the Czech Republic and ahead of Poland.
The agency warned against inflation, saying the OECD urged Slovenia's government to lower medium-term inflation via price liberalisation and to implement structural reforms to the pension system.
Currently virtually all pensions in Slovenia are paid from the public pension scheme which represents a huge burden on public spending.
The annual inflation rate in June eased to 8.8 percent from 8.9 percent in May and 10.5 percent in June last year. -- Marja Novak, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
